TopicTitle: Key binding for Staging/Docking UI switch?

Articles.Content:
I'm playing with a Joystick that has lots of buttons, and I'd like to be able to switch between Staging UI and Docking UI with the joystick. However, it seems that there is no option to configure that binding in the Settings, so only the Insert and Delete keys on my keyboard work. I've looked through the Settings and I've tried searching around, but found no answer to this.

Any help is welcome!

Edited June 15, 2015 by mtu

Which joystick? Pic might help.

Default binding to switch between staging/docking is.... um.... I see there isn't one, just ins/del as you said. But you know what, hardly anyone uses docking mode, so I'm not sure why you want to. Some people think they need it for translating or a good camera angle, but there are other ways around that. Use V (or whatever button you assign) to switch camera to chase, and use IJKL/HN for translating, mapping translation controls to your hat switch (hopefully you have one). Hope that helps.

In settings.cfg there is:

UIMODE_STAGING
{
	primary = Insert
	secondary = None
	group = 0
	switchState = Any
}
UIMODE_DOCKING
{
	primary = Delete
	secondary = None
	group = 0
	switchState = Any
}

Can you change the secondary to a joystick button?
Yes, that worked! Funny the game doesn't let you change that in the settings. Thanks a lot!
